content.question:
A popular musician believes an increase in the number of times songs are listened to via a streaming service leads to an increase in recording sales. The musician’s recording company selected 50 songs at random and used the data to test the claim that there is a positive linear relationship between the number of times a song is listened to and recording sales. The following hypotheses were used to test the claim.

<math alttext="H sub 0: beta sub 1 equals 0. H sub a: beta sub 1 is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>β</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The test yielded a <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 1.592 with a corresponding <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.059. Which of the following is the correct interpretation of the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value?

choices.label: If the alternative hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of 1.592 or smaller is 0.059.
If the alternative hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of 1.592 or greater is 0.059.
If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of 1.592 or greater is 0.059.
If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of 1.592 is 0.059.
If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of 1.592 or smaller is 0.059.

content.answer: If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a test statistic of 1.592 or greater is 0.059.

topic.text: 9.5: Carrying Out a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
